ns2:testcase.ns3:title: FS-TD-003/3.6.1/Creating tier structure.
ns2:testcase.ns3:description:
The hierarchy of the required interest penalty day tiers based on the tenure/term length of term deposit accounts can be defined with the fields given below. The lowest tier in terms of tenure should be defined first (Sl Number “1”) and the higher levels should come sequentially. i.Term (up to)
User has to input the tenure/term length of the term deposit account up to which the penalty tier is applicable. It has to be read in combination with the term basis of the penalty routine code.
For example, if the term basis is in days and user has input “7” in this field, it indicates that the tier is applicable for accounts with term length from 1 day to 7 days.
For the second tier, if user has input “30”, it has to be read as “all accounts with term length from 8 days to 30 days, inclusive of both days”. ii.Interest Penalty (Days)
User has to input the number of days of penalty that has to be charged for term accounts undergoing partial or full early redemption with a term length falling in the range selected. If the user inputs “999”, it will be read as “All Accrued Interest” by the system. iii.Minimum Flat Fee Penalty
User has to input the minimum penalty amount that has to be charged for term accounts undergoing partial or full early redemption. iv.Grace Period (Days)
This field is used to setup the grace period for penalty calculation. If the redemption is happening within the grace period, no penalty will be calculated. But note that grace period is not applicable for new accounts – it will be applicable only for renewed accounts.
For example, if the term field is defined as “7” and grace period in days is defined as “2”, a term account with tenure of say 6 days closing within the first two days after renewal would attract no penalty. The grace period will be applicable only after renewal. Success Criteria: All the above fields are mandatory while creating a tier
ns2:testcase.ns3:creator: v070424
